title: Can a society exist without a state? - Quora

response.answer_text: moral and ethical codes can be different for different people but legal code is same for everyone. It is binding on everyone. This gives common ground to enable a smooth functioning. Without a state, it is difficult to enforce the legal code.

You can have on online community. But even if it had a robust digital economy, the people involved would live in the real world and they would be paying taxes to a state, subject to its laws and so forth. To pretend otherwise would be false. No one is stopping a subculture from forming. Without sovereignty, it is not a state.
Of course. just look at any isolated tribe in the jungles of South America, or on a South Seas island, and you will find examples of exactly this.
